title: Gordon Brown | Prime Minister of UK, Labour Party Leader | Britannica

quotes: Gordon Brown... served as chancellor of the Exchequer (1997–2007)
Gordon Brown... served as... prime minister of the United Kingdom (2007–10)
he served as a university lecturer, first at Edinburgh (1975–76)
he served as a university lecturer... then at Glasgow College of Technology (now part of Glasgow Caledonian University; 1976–80)
Brown left academia for an appointment at Scottish TV (1980–83)
In 1982 he completed a doctorate in history at Edinburgh
In 1974 Brown had helped organize the parliamentary campaign to elect Robin Cook
Brown himself unsuccessfully stood for election to the House of Commons in 1979
winning a seat in Parliament in 1983 as MP for Dunfermline East
From 1987 he served in Labour’s shadow cabinet
In 1992, following Labour’s fourth successive electoral defeat, Brown was named shadow chancellor of the Exchequer
